results.title: Ghana: ways forward
results.brief_description: Considers that progress in the form pf automation may have come too early for a country like Ghana. Now many of the population are idle. Looks at government instigated self-help programmes, which utilise the country’s biggest resource - people and aid in productivity.
results.description: Considers that progress in the form pf automation may have come too early for a country like Ghana. Now many of the population are idle. Looks at government instigated self-help programmes, which utilise the country’s biggest resource - people and aid in productivity.

results.title: Land divers of Melanesia
results.creator_credit: Karl Muller, Robert Gardner and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Documents the salient features of the intact culture of Melanesia, including agriculture, play and ritual of Bunlap on Pentecost Island in the New Hebrides. Shows the relationship between yam agriculture and ceremonies such as land diving.

results.title: In the beginning
results.brief_description: A colourful clay animation film which satirizes society and its impulse to invent nuclear weapons which cause self-destruction. Looks at the invention of destructive weapons from raspberries to rockets! Narration: Brian Woods. Animation: Mark D’Arcy-Irvine, Masfufah Sani. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: A Zoo's eye view: dawn to dark
results.creator_credit: James A. Oliver, Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Depicts the drama of a typical day at the San Diego Zoo. Shows the morning visitors, lively animals, an afternoon thunderstorm, and the quiet that returns as night draws near. Suitable for primary grades.

results.title: Ways of water
results.creator_credit: Gregory Heimer and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Examines the undisturbed nature of water, explaining the difference forms as ice, streams, dew, mist, rain, clouds and the sea. Shows the relationship between water and the forests, insects, fish, birds and other elements. Filmed at the Olympic National Park in the State of Washington, USA.

results.title: Safe Skateboarding
results.creator_credit: Billy Emmerson, Robert Springer and American Educational Films
results.brief_description: Outlines safety procedures and regulations regarding skateboard use. Includes information on maintenance of the board, riding techniques and protective clothing. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Mind machines
results.brief_description: Discusses research being done on artificial intelligence, a branch of computer science. Explores possible developments such as computer controlled robots equipped with a sense of vision and the ability to respond flexibly to changing conditions.

results.title: Fire in the sea
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Views the movement of lava in the countryside and into the sea, as Kilauea, the second greatest volcanic eruption in Hawaii’s history occurs. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Choosing what to buy
results.creator_credit: Howard Potter, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and H S Potter Productions
results.brief_description: Uses animation, song, puppetry and pantomime to illustrate basic economic concepts for spending money wisely. Deals with the problems of limited resources and unlimited wants, opportunity cost, and the importance of rational decision making in the market place. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Howard Potter, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and H S Potter Productions
